segment.source: Creating a Custom Compatibility Mode in Compatibility Administrator (Windows 10)
segment.target: Creating a Custom Compatibility Mode in Compatibility Administrator (Windows 10)

segment.source: Windows® provides several compatibility modes, groups of compatibility fixes found to resolve many common application-compatibility issues.
segment.target: Windows® provides several compatibility modes, groups of compatibility fixes found to resolve many common application-compatibility issues.

segment.source: Creating a Custom Compatibility Mode in Compatibility Administrator
segment.target: Creating a Custom Compatibility Mode in Compatibility Administrator

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows 8.1

segment.source: Windows 8
segment.target: Windows 8

segment.source: Windows 7
segment.target: Windows 7

segment.source: Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Windows Server 2012

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2

segment.source: Windows® provides several compatibility modes, groups of compatibility fixes found to resolve many common application-compatibility issues.
segment.target: Windows® provides several compatibility modes, groups of compatibility fixes found to resolve many common application-compatibility issues.

segment.source: While working with Compatibility Administrator, you might decide to group some of your individual compatibility fixes into a custom-compatibility mode, which you can then deploy and use on any of your compatibility databases.
segment.target: While working with Compatibility Administrator, you might decide to group some of your individual compatibility fixes into a custom-compatibility mode, which you can then deploy and use on any of your compatibility databases.

segment.source: What Is a Compatibility Mode?
segment.target: What Is a Compatibility Mode?

segment.source: A compatibility mode is a group of compatibility fixes.
segment.target: A compatibility mode is a group of compatibility fixes.

segment.source: A compatibility fix, previously known as a shim, is a small piece of code that intercepts API calls from applications.
segment.target: A compatibility fix, previously known as a shim, is a small piece of code that intercepts API calls from applications.

segment.source: The fix transforms the API calls so that the current version of the operating system supports the application in the same way as previous versions of the operating system.
segment.target: The fix transforms the API calls so that the current version of the operating system supports the application in the same way as previous versions of the operating system.

segment.source: This can be anything from disabling a new feature in Windows to emulating a particular behavior of an older version of the Windows API.
segment.target: This can be anything from disabling a new feature in Windows to emulating a particular behavior of an older version of the Windows API.

segment.source: Searching for Existing Compatibility Modes
segment.target: Searching for Existing Compatibility Modes

segment.source: The Compatibility Administrator tool has preloaded fixes for many common applications, including known compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, and AppHelp messages.
segment.target: The Compatibility Administrator tool has preloaded fixes for many common applications, including known compatibility fixes, compatibility modes, and AppHelp messages.

segment.source: Before you create a new compatibility mode, you can search for an existing application and then copy and paste the known fixes into your custom database.
segment.target: Before you create a new compatibility mode, you can search for an existing application and then copy and paste the known fixes into your custom database.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) installs a 32-bit and a 64-bit version of the Compatibility Administrator tool.
segment.target: Application Compatibility Toolkit (ACT) installs a 32-bit and a 64-bit version of the Compatibility Administrator tool.

segment.source: You must use the 32-bit version to create custom databases for 32-bit applications and the 64-bit version to create custom databases for 64-bit applications.
segment.target: You must use the 32-bit version to create custom databases for 32-bit applications and the 64-bit version to create custom databases for 64-bit applications.

segment.source: To search for an existing application
segment.target: To search for an existing application

segment.source: In the left-side pane of Compatibility Administrator, expand the Applications folder and search for your application name.
segment.target: In the left-side pane of Compatibility Administrator, expand the Applications folder and search for your application name.

segment.source: Click the application name to view the preloaded compatibility modes, compatibility fixes, or AppHelp messages.
segment.target: Click the application name to view the preloaded compatibility modes, compatibility fixes, or AppHelp messages.

segment.source: Creating a New Compatibility Mode
segment.target: Creating a New Compatibility Mode

segment.source: If you are unable to find a preloaded compatibility mode for your application, you can create a new one for use by your custom database.
segment.target: If you are unable to find a preloaded compatibility mode for your application, you can create a new one for use by your custom database.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: A compatibility mode includes a set of compatibility fixes and must be deployed as a group.
segment.target: A compatibility mode includes a set of compatibility fixes and must be deployed as a group.

segment.source: Therefore, you should include only fixes that you intend to deploy together to the database.
segment.target: Therefore, you should include only fixes that you intend to deploy together to the database.

segment.source: To create a new compatibility mode
segment.target: To create a new compatibility mode

segment.source: In the left-side pane of Compatibility Administrator, underneath the Custom Databases heading, right-click the name of the database to which you will apply the compatibility mode, click Create New, and then click Compatibility Mode.
segment.target: In the left-side pane of Compatibility Administrator, underneath the Custom Databases heading, right-click the name of the database to which you will apply the compatibility mode, click Create New, and then click Compatibility Mode.

segment.source: Type the name of your custom-compatibility mode into the Name of the compatibility mode text box.
segment.target: Type the name of your custom-compatibility mode into the Name of the compatibility mode text box.

segment.source: Select each of the available compatibility fixes to include in your custom-compatibility mode and then click .
segment.target: Select each of the available compatibility fixes to include in your custom-compatibility mode and then click .

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: If you are unsure which compatibility fixes to add, you can click Copy Mode.
segment.target: If you are unsure which compatibility fixes to add, you can click Copy Mode.

segment.source: The Select Compatibility Mode dialog box appears and enables you to select from the preloaded compatibility modes.
segment.target: The Select Compatibility Mode dialog box appears and enables you to select from the preloaded compatibility modes.

segment.source: After you select a compatibility mode and click OK, any compatibility fixes that are included in the preloaded compatibility mode will be automatically added to your custom-compatibility mode.
segment.target: After you select a compatibility mode and click OK, any compatibility fixes that are included in the preloaded compatibility mode will be automatically added to your custom-compatibility mode.

segment.source: If you have any compatibility fixes that require additional parameters, you can select the fix, and then click Parameters.
segment.target: If you have any compatibility fixes that require additional parameters, you can select the fix, and then click Parameters.

segment.source: The Options for CompatibilityFixName dialog box appears, enabling you to update the parameter fields.
segment.target: The Options for CompatibilityFixName dialog box appears, enabling you to update the parameter fields.

segment.source: After you are done selecting the compatibility fixes to include, click OK.
segment.target: After you are done selecting the compatibility fixes to include, click OK.

segment.source: The compatibility mode is added to your custom database.
segment.target: The compatibility mode is added to your custom database.

segment.target: Related topics
